intro: Minyranthes, commonly known as the common milkweed, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinctive botanical feature. The plant typically has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink or purple in color. Minyranthes is often found in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes and stream banks.
